tit.e: The Umami-kofun Tumuli Cluster (Tumuli Cluster around Umami-kyuryo Hill)
tit.cmt: 用語を変え、補足しました。
tit.e: The Umami-kofun Tumuli Cluster (Tumuli Cluster around Umami-kyuryo Hill)

sen.j: 馬見古墳群（うまみこふんぐん）は奈良盆地西南部、奈良県北葛城郡河合町、広陵町から大和高田市にかけて広がる馬見丘陵とその周辺に築かれた。
sen.e: The Umami burial mounds are the most famous cluster of old burial mounds in Nara Prefecture, consists of three clusters: North cluster, Middle cluster and South cluster.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Umami-kofun Tumuli Cluster was constructed around the Umami-kyuryo Hill which was stretched from Kawai Town, Koryo Town of Kitakatsuragi County to Yamato Takada City, Nara Prefecture, in the southwest area of the Nara Basin.
sen.cmt: 原文の分割方法が不適切だったため、ウェブを元に、一旦原文を1文に戻した後、再度分割しました。
sen.e: The Umami-kofun Tumuli Cluster was constructed around the Umami-kyuryo Hill which was stretched from Kawai Town, Koryo Town of Kitakatsuragi County to Yamato Takada City, Nara Prefecture, in the southwest area of the Nara Basin.

sen.j: 北群、中郡、南群の3群からなる県下でも有数の古墳群。
sen.e: It was constructed in southwest area of the Nara Basin and in and around the Umami Hill stretched from Kawai Town, Koryo Town to Yamato Takada City, Kitakatsuragi Province, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It was one of the most famous tumuli clusters in Nara Prefecture, consisting of three groups: North group, Middle group and South group.
sen.cmt: 原文の分割方法が不適切だったため、ウェブを元に、一旦原文を1文に戻した後、再度分割しました。
sen.e: It was one of the most famous tumuli clusters in Nara Prefecture, consisting of three groups: North group, Middle group and South group.

sen.j: 4世紀末から6世紀にかけて造営されたと見られる。
sen.e: The Umami burial mounds were constructed between the end of fourth century and sixth century.
It was constructed between the end of fourth century and sixth century.
It was constructed between the end of fourth century and sixth century.

sen.j: 古代豪族・葛城氏の墓域とみる説もある。
sen.e: There is a view that it is the cemetery area of the Katsuragi clan, which was an ancient local ruling family.
There is a view that it is the cemetery area of the Katsuragi clan, which was an ancient local ruling family.
There is a view that it is the cemetery area of the Katsuragi clan, which was an ancient local ruling family.

sen.j: この葛城地域には、古墳時代前期の中頃から有力な古墳の造営が始まった。
sen.e: In the Katsuragi region, construction of famous burial mounds started from the middle of the early Kofun period (tumulus period).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the Katsuragi region, construction of famous tumulus started from the middle of the early Kofun period (Tumulus period).
In the Katsuragi region, construction of famous tumulus started from the middle of the early Kofun period (Tumulus period).

sen.j: 前期中葉から中期には、墳丘長200メートルを超える規模の古墳が造営されている。
sen.e: In the mid-early period to the middle period, burial mounds of more than 200 meters long were constructed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the mid-early period to the middle period, tumuli of more than 200 meters long were constructed.
In the mid-early period to the middle period, tumuli of more than 200 meters long were constructed.

sen.j: 主な古墳
sen.e: Major burial mounds
Major Tumulus
Major Tumulus

sen.j: 新山古墳（しんやま）（広陵町大塚、前期、前方後方墳、137メートル） - 34面の銅鏡が出土、
sen.e: The Shinyama Tumulus: Otsuka, Koryo Town; the early Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped burial mound with a quadrangular rear portion; 137 meters; and 34 bronze mirrors were excavated.
The Shinyama-kofun Tumulus: Otsuka, Koryo Town; the early Kofun period; a square-front, square-back mound; 137 meters; and 34 bronze mirrors were excavated.
sen.cmt: 用語を変え、用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: The Shinyama-kofun Tumulus: Otsuka, Koryo Town; the early Kofun period; a square-front, square-back mound; 137 meters; and 34 bronze mirrors were excavated.

sen.j: 巣山（すやま）古墳 （広陵町三吉、前期、前方後円墳、204メートル） - 特別史跡。
sen.e: The Suyama Tumulus: Mitsuyoshi, Koryo Town; the early Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped burial mound; 204 meters; and a special historic site.
The Suyama-kofun Tumulus: Mitsuyoshi, Koryo Town; the early Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped mound; 204 meters; and a special historic site.
The Suyama-kofun Tumulus: Mitsuyoshi, Koryo Town; the early Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped mound; 204 meters; and a special historic site.

sen.j: 日本を代表する周濠型前方後円墳
sen.e: It is the most famous moat surrounding, keyhole-shaped burial mound in Japan.
sen.cmt: 「日本を代表する」を日本で一番有名な、と理解しました。
sen.e: Popular Moat Surrounding, Keyhole-Shaped Tumulus in Japan
Popular Moat Surrounding, Keyhole-Shaped Tumulus in Japan

sen.j: 築山古墳 (大和高田市)（大和高田市築山、中期、前方後円墳、210メートル）- 天皇陵
sen.e: The Tsukiyama Tumulus (Yamato Takada City): Tsukiyama, Yamato Takada City; the middle Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped burial mound; 210 meters; and an imperial mausoleum.
The Tsukiyama-kofun Tumulus: Tsukiyama, Yamato Takada City; the middle Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped mound; 210 meters; and an imperial mausoleum.
sen.cmt: 原文には (大和高田市)とありますが、リンク先の単語が抽出されるバグのようですので、削除しました。また用語を変えました。
sen.e: The Tsukiyama-kofun Tumulus: Tsukiyama, Yamato Takada City; the middle Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped mound; 210 meters; and an imperial mausoleum.

sen.j: 新木山（にきやま）古墳 （広陵町新木山、中期、前方後円墳、200メートル） - 陵墓参考地
sen.e: The Nikiyama Tumulus: Nikiyama, Koryo Town; the middle Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped burial mound; 200 meters; and a potential site for imperial mausoleums.
The Nikiyama-kofun Tumulus: Nikiyama, Koryo Town; the middle Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped mound; 200 meters; and a potential site for imperial mausoleums.
The Nikiyama-kofun Tumulus: Nikiyama, Koryo Town; the middle Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped mound; 200 meters; and a potential site for imperial mausoleums.

sen.j: 川合大塚山古墳 （河合町川合、中期、前方後円墳、195メートル）
sen.e: The Kawai Otsukayama Tumulus: Kawai, Kawai Town; the middle Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped burial mound; and 195 meters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Kawai Otsukayama-kofun Tumulus: Kawai, Kawai Town; the middle Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped mound; and 195 meters.
The Kawai Otsukayama-kofun Tumulus: Kawai, Kawai Town; the middle Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped mound; and 195 meters.

sen.j: 大塚山古墳群は馬見古墳群に含めない見解もある。
sen.e: There is a view that the Kawai Otsukayama Tumulus is not included in the Umami burial mounds.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There is a view that the Otsukayama-kofun Tumuli Cluster is not included in the Umami-kofun Tumuli Cluster.
There is a view that the Otsukayama-kofun Tumuli Cluster is not included in the Umami-kofun Tumuli Cluster.

sen.j: 領家山（りょうけやま）古墳 （大和高田市領家） - 鶏頭埴輪などが出土
sen.e: The Ryokeyama Tumulus: Ryoke, Yamato Takada City; chicken-head haniwa (funerary figures) were found.
The Ryokeyama-kofun Tumulus: Ryoke, Yamato Takada City; chicken-head haniwa (funerary figures) were excavated.
The Ryokeyama-kofun Tumulus: Ryoke, Yamato Takada City; chicken-head haniwa (funerary figures) were excavated.

sen.j: 佐味田ナガレ山古墳 （河合町佐味田（さみた）） - 史跡
sen.e: The Samita Nagareyama Tumulus: Samita, Kawai Town; and a historic site.
The Samita Nagareyama-kofun Tumulus: Samita, Kawai Town; and a historic site.
The Samita Nagareyama-kofun Tumulus: Samita, Kawai Town; and a historic site.

sen.j: 佐味田宝塚古墳 （河合町佐味田） - 史跡。
sen.e: The Samida Takarazuka Tumulus: Samita, Kawai Town; and a historic site.
The Samida Takarazuka-kofun Tumulus: Samita, Kawai Town; and a historic site.
The Samida Takarazuka-kofun Tumulus: Samita, Kawai Town; and a historic site.

sen.j: 30面を超える銅鏡が出土。
sen.e: More than 30 bronze mirrors were excavated.
More than 30 bronze mirrors were excavated.
More than 30 bronze mirrors were excavated.

sen.j: その中に鏡背に四棟の家屋文様が描かれた家屋文鏡がある。
sen.e: Among them, there are Kaoku Monkyo (ancient mirrors on which icons of four types of houses were curved).
Among them, there is Kaoku Monkyo, an ancient mirror on which icons of four types of houses were curved on its back.
Among them, there is Kaoku Monkyo, an ancient mirror on which icons of four types of houses were curved on its back.

sen.j: 葛城王朝末期の宮殿の模様を描いたもので、それぞれの文様から高殿、高屋、高倉、殿舎であろうと推測されている。
sen.e: It is imagined that the icons describes the design of the palace of the late Katsuragi Dynasty and that the four types of houses are Takadono (a building placed on the high place), Kouoku (a raised-floor house), Takakura (a raised storehouse) and Densha (a palace).
sen.cmt: 「王朝交替説葛城王朝説末期の宮殿の模様を描いた」、と原文にありましたが、意味が通じずwikiを確認したところ、wikiには「葛城王朝末期の宮殿の模様を描いたもので」とありましたので、削除しています。
sen.e: It is imagined that the icons describe the design of the palace of the late Katsuragi Dynasty and that the four types of houses are Takadono (a building placed on the high place), Ko-oku (a raised-floor house), Takakura (a raised storehouse) and Densha (a palace).

It is imagined that the icons describe the design of the palace of the late Katsuragi Dynasty and that the four types of houses are Takadono (a building placed on the high place), Ko-oku (a raised-floor house), Takakura (a raised storehouse) and Densha (a palace).

sen.j: 狐井城山古墳（香芝市狐井・良福寺、後期、前方後円墳、140メートル）
sen.e: The Kitsui Shiroyama Tumulus: Kitsui and Ryofukuji, Kashiba City; the late Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped burial mound; and 140 meters.
The Kitsui Shiroyama-kofun Tumulus: Kitsui and Ryofukuji, Kashiba City; the late Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped mound; and 140 meters.
The Kitsui Shiroyama-kofun Tumulus: Kitsui and Ryofukuji, Kashiba City; the late Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped mound; and 140 meters.

sen.j: 島の山古墳（川西町唐院、前期、前方後円墳、195メートル）
sen.e: The Shimanoyama Tumulus: Toin, Kawanishi Town; the early Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped burial mound; and 195 meters.
The Shimanoyama-kofun Tumulus: Toin, Kawanishi Town; the early Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped mound; and 195 meters.
The Shimanoyama-kofun Tumulus: Toin, Kawanishi Town; the early Kofun period; a keyhole-shaped mound; and 195 meters.
